alert.note: Alert for Bullock; Montgomery (Alabama) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 15 at 2:35PM CDT by NWS Birmingham
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northwestern Bullock and southeastern Montgomery Counties through 315 PM CDT... At 234 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Meadville, moving east at 25 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Meadville, Pine Level, Shopton, Dublin, Mitchell, Simsville, High Ridge and Carters Hill. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
